verses.kjv: Now the sons of Issachar were, Tola, and Puah, Jashub, and Shimrom, four.
verses.ct: Issachar had 4 sons: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimrom.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Tola; Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father’s house, to wit, of Tola: they were valiant men of might in their generations; whose number was in the days of David two and twenty thousand and six hundred.
verses.ct: Tola's sons were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Jibsam, and Shemuel. These were the leaders of Tola's family line — brave warriors across their generations. During David's reign, their number totaled 22,600.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Uzzi; Izrahiah: and the sons of Izrahiah; Michael, and Obadiah, and Joel, Ishiah, five: all of them chief men.
verses.ct: Uzzi's son was Izrahiah, and Izrahiah's sons were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Ishiah — 5 in all. Every one of them was a leader.

verses.kjv: And with them, by their generations, after the house of their fathers, were bands of soldiers for war, six and thirty thousand men: for they had many wives and sons.
verses.ct: According to their family records, they had 36,000 troops ready for battle, because they had many wives and children.

verses.kjv: And their brethren among all the families of Issachar were valiant men of might, reckoned in all by their genealogies fourscore and seven thousand.
verses.ct: Their relatives throughout all the clans of Issachar were brave warriors, totaling 87,000 as recorded in their genealogies.

verses.kjv: The sons of Benjamin; Bela, and Becher, and Jediael, three.
verses.ct: Benjamin had 3 sons: Bela, Becher, and Jediael.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Bela; Ezbon, and Uzzi, and Uzziel, and Jerimoth, and Iri, five; heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valour; and were reckoned by their genealogies twenty and two thousand and thirty and four.
verses.ct: Bela's sons were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri — 5 in all. They were family leaders and powerful warriors, and their genealogical records listed 22,034 men.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Becher; Zemira, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jerimoth, and Abiah, and Anathoth, and Alameth. All these are the sons of Becher.
verses.ct: Becher's sons were Zemira, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jerimoth, Abiah, Anathoth, and Alameth. All of these were Becher's descendants.

verses.kjv: And the number of them, after their genealogy by their generations, heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valour, was twenty thousand and two hundred.
verses.ct: Their genealogical records listed them by generations as family leaders and mighty warriors — 20,200 in all.

verses.kjv: The sons also of Jediael; Bilhan: and the sons of Bilhan; Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tharshish, and Ahishahar.
verses.ct: Jediael's son was Bilhan, and Bilhan's sons were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tharshish, and Ahishahar.

verses.kjv: All these the sons of Jediael, by the heads of their fathers, mighty men of valour, were seventeen thousand and two hundred soldiers, fit to go out for war and battle.
verses.ct: All of these descendants of Jediael were family leaders and mighty warriors — 17,200 soldiers ready to march out for war.

verses.kjv: Shuppim also, and Huppim, the children of Ir, and Hushim, the sons of Aher.
verses.ct: Shuppim and Huppim were descendants of Ir, and Hushim was a descendant of Aher.

verses.kjv: The sons of Naphtali; Jahziel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
verses.ct: Naphtali's sons were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum — descendants of Bilhah.

verses.kjv: The sons of Manasseh; Ashriel, whom she bare: (but his concubine the Aramitess bare Machir the father of Gilead:
verses.ct: Manasseh's descendants included Ashriel, whom his wife bore. His Aramean secondary wife gave birth to Machir, the father of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And Machir took to wife the sister of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name was Maachah;) and the name of the second was Zelophehad: and Zelophehad had daughters.
verses.ct: Machir married a woman from the family of Huppim and Shuppim; her name was Maachah. The second notable descendant was Zelophehad, and Zelophehad had only daughters.

verses.kjv: And Maachah the wife of Machir bare a son, and she called his name Peresh; and the name of his brother was Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
verses.ct: Maachah, Machir's wife, gave birth to a son and named him Peresh. His brother's name was Sheresh, and Sheresh's sons were Ulam and Rakem.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Ulam; Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
verses.ct: Ulam's son was Bedan. These were the descendants of Gilead son of Machir, son of Manasseh.

verses.kjv: And his sister Hammoleketh bare Ishod, and Abiezer, and Mahalah.
verses.ct: His sister Hammoleketh gave birth to Ishod, Abiezer, and Mahalah.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Shemidah were, Ahian, and Shechem, and Likhi, and Aniam.
verses.ct: Shemidah's sons were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Ephraim; Shuthelah, and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eladah his son, and Tahath his son,
verses.ct: Ephraim's descendants in succession were: Shuthelah, then Bered, then Tahath, then Eladah, then Tahath,

verses.kjv: And Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer, and Elead, whom the men of Gath that were born in that land slew, because they came down to take away their cattle.
verses.ct: then Zabad, then Shuthelah. Ezer and Elead were killed by the native-born men of Gath because they went down to steal their livestock.

verses.kjv: And Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.
verses.ct: Their father Ephraim grieved for many days, and his brothers came to console him.

verses.kjv: And when he went in to his wife, she conceived, and bare a son, and he called his name Beriah, because it went evil with his house.
verses.ct: Then he had relations with his wife, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. He named him Beriah, because disaster had struck his household.

verses.kjv: (And his daughter was Sherah, who built Bethhoron the nether, and the upper, and Uzzensherah.)
verses.ct: (His daughter was Sherah, who built Lower Beth-horon, Upper Beth-horon, and Uzzen-sherah.)

verses.kjv: And Rephah was his son, also Resheph, and Telah his son, and Tahan his son,
verses.ct: His descendants in succession were Rephah, then Resheph, then Telah, then Tahan,

verses.kjv: Laadan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
verses.ct: then Laadan, then Ammihud, then Elishama,

verses.kjv: Non his son, Jehoshuah his son,
verses.ct: then Non, then Jehoshuah.

verses.kjv: And their possessions and habitations were, Bethel and the towns thereof, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer, with the towns thereof; Shechem also and the towns thereof, unto Gaza and the towns thereof:
verses.ct: Their lands and settlements included Bethel and its surrounding towns, Naaran to the east, Gezer and its surrounding towns to the west, as well as Shechem and its surrounding towns all the way to Gaza and its surrounding towns.

verses.kjv: And by the borders of the children of Manasseh, Bethshean and her towns, Taanach and her towns, Megiddo and her towns, Dor and her towns. In these dwelt the children of Joseph the son of Israel.
verses.ct: Along the borders of Manasseh's territory were Beth-shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, and Dor and its towns. The descendants of Joseph son of Israel lived in all these places.

verses.kjv: The sons of Asher; Imnah, and Isuah, and Ishuai, and Beriah, and Serah their sister.
verses.ct: Asher's sons were Imnah, Isuah, Ishuai, and Beriah, along with their sister Serah.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Beriah; Heber, and Malchiel, who is the father of Birzavith.
verses.ct: Beriah's sons were Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzavith.

verses.kjv: And Heber begat Japhlet, and Shomer, and Hotham, and Shua their sister.
verses.ct: Heber became the father of Japhlet, Shomer, and Hotham, along with their sister Shua.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Japhlet; Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.
verses.ct: Japhlet's sons were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were Japhlet's descendants.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Shamer; Ahi, and Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.
verses.ct: Shamer's sons were Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

verses.kjv: And the sons of his brother Helem; Zophah, and Imna, and Shelesh, and Amal.
verses.ct: His brother Helem's sons were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.

verses.kjv: The sons of Zophah; Suah, and Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,
verses.ct: Zophah's sons were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,

verses.kjv: Bezer, and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.
verses.ct: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Jether; Jephunneh, and Pispah, and Ara.
verses.ct: Jether's sons were Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Ulla; Arah, and Haniel, and Rezia.
verses.ct: Ulla's sons were Arah, Haniel, and Rezia.

verses.kjv: All these were the children of Asher, heads of their father’s house, choice and mighty men of valour, chief of the princes. And the number throughout the genealogy of them that were apt to the war and to battle was twenty and six thousand men.
verses.ct: All of these were descendants of Asher — family leaders, outstanding and mighty warriors, and chief among the princes. Their genealogical records counted 26,000 men fit for military service.
